customerPersona.name: Marcus Thorne
customerPersona.background: Marcus has spent 15 years in the automotive aftermarket sector, transitioning from fleet operations to executive leadership in digital transformation. He previously spearheaded a national loyalty program that integrated IoT devices into consumer vehicles and is now focused on leveraging AI to reduce customer friction in the repair process.
goals: Increase lead generation for partner service centers by providing users with immediate diagnostic results
Establish the brand as the primary digital authority for non-technical drivers who feel intimidated by traditional mechanics
Collect anonymized acoustic data to build the world's largest proprietary database of vehicle failure signatures
painPoints: Low conversion rates from 'check engine' lights to actual service appointments due to user anxiety
The high cost of manual customer support for basic technical vehicle inquiries
Competition from legacy OBD-II scanner manufacturers who are beginning to enter the mobile app space
successMetrics: Conversion rate from 'Next Steps' screen to 'Locate a Mechanic' clicks
AI diagnosis accuracy verified by participating professional mechanics
Reduction in the average time between a fault detection and a service booking
customerPersona.communicationStyle: Results-oriented and high-level; prefers data-driven executive summaries and bi-weekly milestone demos over daily technical updates.

userPersonas.name: Sarah Jenkins
userPersonas.background: Sarah relies on her 8-year-old sedan for a daily 40-minute commute. She has no mechanical knowledge and feels a high level of anxiety whenever her car makes an unfamiliar noise, fearing she will be stranded or overcharged by a mechanic.
goals: Determine if a new car sound requires immediate attention or can wait until the weekend
Avoid feeling uneducated or intimidated when talking to service advisors
Budget effectively for upcoming repairs based on realistic cost estimates
frustrations: Difficulty describing abstract sounds like 'thumping' or 'whirring' to professionals
The fear that a small sound indicates a catastrophic and expensive failure
Feeling pressured to agree to repairs she doesn't fully understand
behaviors: Turns down the radio to listen intently to engine noises
Searches YouTube for 'car making squeaking noise' to find a match
Asks friends or family members for their opinion on her car's health
accessibility: Visual urgency indicators (color-coded) for high-stress situations

userPersonas.name: David Chen
userPersonas.background: David is currently shopping for his first car on a limited budget. He spends his weekends visiting private sellers from online marketplaces and needs a quick, reliable way to vet the mechanical integrity of vehicles without paying for a professional inspection every time.
goals: Identify 'red flag' engine or transmission noises during a short test drive
Use diagnostic data as leverage to negotiate a lower purchase price
Confirm that a seller's 'well-maintained' claim matches the actual acoustic signature of the car
frustrations: Sellers who are dishonest about the vehicle's mechanical history
The high cost and logistical difficulty of scheduling a pre-purchase inspection (PPI)
Wasting time traveling to see cars that have obvious mechanical flaws
behaviors: Checks the engine bay and undercarriage while the car is idling
Records clips of the car starting up to analyze later
Compares multiple vehicles within the same week
accessibility: High-contrast UI for outdoor use in bright sunlight

userPersonas.name: Marcus 'Mike' Rodriguez
userPersonas.background: Mike enjoys performing his own basic maintenance and minor repairs to save money and stay productive. While he is handy with a wrench, he sometimes struggles to pinpoint the exact source of a noise among various moving parts.
goals: Validate his own mechanical hypothesis before purchasing replacement parts
Differentiate between similar-sounding issues like a bad alternator bearing versus a worn idler pulley
Track the health of his vehicle over time to prevent major failures
frustrations: Buying and installing a part only to find the noise persists
Ambient garage noise making it hard to isolate specific mechanical clicks
Difficulty finding reliable technical specs for older vehicle models
behaviors: Records sounds from multiple angles (under the hood vs. wheel well)
References digital forums and repair manuals alongside app results
Maintains a digital log of all repairs and diagnostic reports
accessibility: Text-to-speech for hands-free operation while working under the car

userStories.title: Noise-Isolated Audio Recording
userStories.story: As a Non-technical Owner, I want the app to filter out background traffic and wind noise while I record, so that the diagnosis is accurate even if I am on the side of a busy road.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the user is in the recording interface, when they press the 'Record' button, then the app captures audio for a minimum of 10 seconds and a maximum of 15 seconds.
Given the recording is in progress, when wind or ambient traffic noise is detected, then the Noise Isolation Algorithm automatically attenuates these frequencies in real-time.
Given the recording is complete, when the audio quality is too poor for analysis, then the user receives a prompt to 'Move closer to the sound source' and retry.

userStories.title: Sound Origin Selection
userStories.story: As a DIY Enthusiast, I want to select the general location of the sound (Engine Bay, Wheels, Undocarriage) before recording, so that the AI focuses on relevant fault signatures.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the user opens the app, when they view the dashboard, then they are presented with selectable zones: Engine Bay, Wheels/Brakes, Suspension/Undocarriage, and Exhaust.
Given 'Wheels/Brakes' is selected, when the analysis begins, then the system prioritizes faults like 'Brake Grinding' or 'Wheel Bearing Hum' over engine knock.
Given a selection is made, when the recording screen loads, then a diagram shows the user where to position the phone for that specific zone.

userStories.title: Traffic Light Urgency Indicator
userStories.story: As a Non-technical Owner, I want to see a Red, Yellow, or Green indicator after analysis, so that I immediately know if the car is unsafe to drive.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the analysis identifies a critical failure (e.g., Rod Knock), when the results load, then a large Red indicator displays with the text 'Stop Driving Immediately / Tow Required'.
Given the analysis identifies a non-critical issue (e.g., Loose Heat Shield), when the results load, then a Green or Yellow indicator displays noting 'Safe to Drive'.
Given the user taps on the urgency indicator, when the modal opens, then a layman-friendly explanation of the risk (e.g., 'Engine seizure risk') is displayed.

userStories.title: Identification with Confidence Score
userStories.story: As a Used Car Buyer, I want to see the identified malfunction name alongside a percentage confidence score, so that I can validate if a seller is hiding a major issue.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the analysis is complete, when the result screen appears, then the primary diagnosis (e.g., 'Alternator Bearing Failure') is shown with a percentage (e.g., '87% Match').
Given the confidence score is below 60%, when the results are shown, then the app displays 'Inconclusive Result' and suggests potential causes rather than a definitive diagnosis.
Given a successful match, when the user expands the result, then a brief description of the mechanical failure is provided.

userStories.title: Reference Sound Comparison
userStories.story: As a DIY Enthusiast, I want to listen to a 'Known Fault' audio sample alongside my recording, so that I can personally verify the AI's diagnosis.
acceptanceCriteria: Given a diagnosis is presented, when the user taps 'Compare Audio', then the UI displays two playback controls: 'Your Recording' and 'Reference Sample'.
Given the reference sample is playing, when the user plays their own recording, then the audio levels are normalized so they can be heard clearly side-by-side.
Given a complex sound, when comparing, then a simple visual waveform of both sounds is displayed to help visually match the rhythm.

userStories.title: Repair Cost Estimator
userStories.story: As a Used Car Buyer, I want to see an estimated repair price range for the diagnosed issue, so that I can negotiate that amount off the vehicle purchase price.
acceptanceCriteria: Given a diagnosis (e.g., 'Serpentine Belt'), when the user views details, then a price range (e.g., '$150 - $250') is displayed based on national averages.
Given the user has not entered vehicle details, when viewing costs, then the app prompts for Make/Model/Year to refine the estimate.
Given a critical engine failure diagnosis, when the cost is displayed, then a disclaimer appears stating 'Major Repair - Professional Inspection Required'.

userStories.title: Local Partner Shop Locator
userStories.story: As a Non-technical Owner, I want to see a list of top-rated local mechanics who specialize in my specific problem, so that I can book an appointment immediately.
acceptanceCriteria: Given a diagnosis is displayed, when the user taps 'Fix This', then a map view loads showing partner repair shops within a 10-mile radius.
Given the list of shops, when displayed, then shops are sorted by user rating and include a 'Partner' badge for verified service centers.
Given a specific shop card, when tapped, then the user can directly call or navigate to the shop via their default map app.

userStories.title: Shareable Diagnostic Report
userStories.story: As a Non-technical Owner, I want to generate a shareable link of the diagnosis and audio, so that I can send it to a mechanic before I arrive.
acceptanceCriteria: Given a completed diagnosis, when the user selects 'Share', then a unique web link is generated containing the fault name, severity, and audio clip.
Given the recipient opens the link, when the page loads, then they see the 'Car Sound Detector' branding and the specific diagnostic details without needing to install the app.
Given the user wants to keep it private, when sharing, then no personal user location data is included in the shared report.

userStories.title: Scan History Log
userStories.story: As a Used Car Buyer, I want to save scans with custom labels (e.g., '2018 Ford Focus'), so that I can compare different cars I test drove later in the day.
acceptanceCriteria: Given a scan is complete, when prompted, then the user can enter a custom text label for the session.
Given the user navigates to the 'History' tab, when the list loads, then previous scans are displayed chronologically with their labels and urgency colors.
Given a saved scan, when tapped, then the full diagnostic report and audio recording are reloaded.
